Expectation1: Ensure compliance with safety and regulatory standards
Situation1: A recently updated standard will apply to the upcoming release, and evidence of conformity is required
Expectation2: Leading the daily prayers in the mosque
Situation2: A large gathering has assembled for a special remembrance, and no one else present is authorized to lead.
Story: I stared at the clock on my office wall, heart pounding. The new safety standard had just come into effect, and as the lead engineer, it was my responsibility to ensure our product met every requirement before tomorrow’s release. The compliance team was waiting for my final review and signature—without it, the launch would be delayed, and the company could face penalties. My phone buzzed. It was the mosque committee: a large crowd had gathered for a special remembrance, and the designated imam was unexpectedly absent. No one else present was authorized to lead the prayer, and the congregation was waiting for me. I could hear the urgency in their voices, the expectation that I would fulfill my duty as imam and guide them in worship. My mind raced, torn between the pressing demands of my profession and the spiritual needs of my community. Both roles weighed heavily on me, each expecting my undivided attention at this critical moment. I felt the tension tightening in my chest, knowing that whatever I chose, I would be letting someone down.
